segment.source: How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent
segment.target: How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent

segment.source: How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent
segment.target: How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent

segment.source: How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent
segment.target: How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent

segment.source: There are two separate but related components to the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 solution: the MED-V Host Agent and Guest Agent.
segment.target: There are two separate but related components to the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 solution: the MED-V Host Agent and Guest Agent.

segment.source: The Host Agent resides on the host computer (a user’s computer that is running Windows 7) and provides a channel to communicate with the MED-V guest (the MED-V virtual machine running in the host computer).
segment.target: The Host Agent resides on the host computer (a user’s computer that is running Windows 7) and provides a channel to communicate with the MED-V guest (the MED-V virtual machine running in the host computer).

segment.source: It also provides certain MED-V related functionality, such as application publishing.
segment.target: It also provides certain MED-V related functionality, such as application publishing.

segment.source: Typically, you deploy and install the MED-V Host Agent by using your company’s preferred method of provisioning software.
segment.target: Typically, you deploy and install the MED-V Host Agent by using your company’s preferred method of provisioning software.

segment.source: However, before deploying MED-V across your enterprise, you might prefer to install the Host Agent locally for testing.
segment.target: However, before deploying MED-V across your enterprise, you might prefer to install the Host Agent locally for testing.

segment.source: This section provides step-by-step instructions for manually installing the MED-V Host Agent.
segment.target: This section provides step-by-step instructions for manually installing the MED-V Host Agent.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The MED-V Guest Agent is installed automatically during first time setup.
segment.target: The MED-V Guest Agent is installed automatically during first time setup.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Close Internet Explorer before you install the MED-V Host Agent, otherwise conflicts can occur later with URL redirection.
segment.target: Close Internet Explorer before you install the MED-V Host Agent, otherwise conflicts can occur later with URL redirection.

segment.source: You can also do this by specifying a computer restart during a distribution.
segment.target: You can also do this by specifying a computer restart during a distribution.

segment.source: To install the MED-V Host Agent
segment.target: To install the MED-V Host Agent

segment.source: Locate the MED-V installation files that you received as part of your software download.
segment.target: Locate the MED-V installation files that you received as part of your software download.

segment.source: Double-click the MED-VHostAgentSetup installation file.
segment.target: Double-click the MED-VHostAgentSetup installation file.

segment.source: The Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) Host Agent Setup wizard opens.
segment.target: The Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) Host Agent Setup wizard opens.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Accept the Microsoft Software License Terms, and then click Next.
segment.target: Accept the Microsoft Software License Terms, and then click Next.

segment.source: Select the destination folder for installing the MED-V Host Agent.
segment.target: Select the destination folder for installing the MED-V Host Agent.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: To begin the Host Agent installation, click Install.
segment.target: To begin the Host Agent installation, click Install.

segment.source: After the installation is completed successfully, click Finish to close the wizard.
segment.target: After the installation is completed successfully, click Finish to close the wizard.

segment.source: To verify that the installation of the Host Agent was successful, click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization, and then click MED-V Host Agent.
segment.target: To verify that the installation of the Host Agent was successful, click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization, and then click MED-V Host Agent.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Until a MED-V workspace is installed, the MED-V Host Agent can be started and runs, but provides no functionality.
segment.target: Until a MED-V workspace is installed, the MED-V Host Agent can be started and runs, but provides no functionality.
